author: Special Correspondent
text:
Left parties and their allies on Monday jointly announced that they would conduct demonstrations in five centres of Union Territory on Thursday against the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) led-Government at Centre for ‘thrusting’ its Hindutva agenda on higher educational institutions across the country.

The leaders, including Communist of Party of India(CPI) unit secretary R.Viswanathan, CPI-M unit secretary R. Rajangam, CPI-(ML) unit secretary S. Balasubramanian, Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi’s principal secretary Deva. Pozhilan, MDMK committee president in-charge A. Chandrasekaran and RSP secretary K.Lenin, participated in the meeting which discussed the strategy to conduct massive demonstrations across the Union Territory.

Mr. Viswanathan told reporters said communal forces have been overactive in trying to thrust their agenda onto the higher educational institutions across the country. In pursuance to its long-time agenda, such forces have unleashed draconian measures against the professors and students in Jawaharlal Nehru University. Under pretext of sedition, they have been perpetrating continuous attacks.

Mr. Viswanathan alleged that the Modi Government has been intensifying the attacks to divert the attention of common people who were affected by the wrong policies of the Centre which has been functioning with agenda of dividing people on religious lines.

The leaders demanded that the sedition case against Kanhaiya Kumar, president of the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students’ Union should be withdrawn .
title: Left slams Hindutva agenda in universities
